reviewText: My kids absolutely love Postman Pat! His stuff is not easy to find in the US so I was pleased to find it on here!
WONERFUL-  our 5 year old's boys and girls loved it-  great message and we all danced to the music at the end!!
Didn't expect much from this one but loved it. Pure entertainment.

My five years old son loved it, he asked me to watch the movie again after the second time! (the only problem was that it's a Zone 1 DVD; I didn't realize it before buying it... but it was my mistake).
Ordered for my two little nephews in the US. Loved by my girls in the UK!
One of the best animation  movie I've ever seen

Jess and Carbuncle are my favorite.  Jess, because hey, he's a cat, and Carbuncle because he is an awesomely over-the-top melodramatic villain.  The humor will go from hitting you over the head to extremely subtle, from dropping a rock on the villain to Pat reading "The Postman Always Rings Twice" in a flashback.  It's not just for kids, and it may run long and be a bit scary at times for really little children, but it is a very good flick.
Rather entertaining. David Tennant voice acting is worth it.
Loved it!  Very humorous and quick delivery too.

very good dvd, need an international dvd player to play it in the US. but i knew this when i purchased it. the kids (1-5 years old) love it, as I did as a child. worth the purchase if you have a region 2 player! if you enjoy wallace and gromit you'd probably enjoy this video a lot too.

I do not like Postman Pat, Postman Pat, Postman black or his black-and-white cat. I actually think I kinda hate them both. I've never really hated anyone before, either. Not to mention the guy hates his freakin' life and it's a little depressing. For example, in the song it says, "Pat THINKS he's a really happy man." WTF is that about?! Anyone who says they think they are happy is crying themselves to sleep every night in the back of their delivery truck while using the letters of unsuspecting townsfolk to dry away the tears streaming down their face. What a miserable human being. Let me know when the guy finally goes postal, which WILL happen - it's only a matter of time. I might tune in to that episode. Oh by the way, my kid loves it. Kill me now.

I understood the point of the movie, which is one should value the labor of another human being, but it did not need an hour and a half to drag out the point.  The movie was slow at times and weird at times, but the animation was friendly in colors and shapes.  I'm sure it would attract kids to watch it because of the animation and the singing/music behind it.  However, it reminds me of the American Idol and Simon Fuller, which is not what I want kids to idolize.  That cannot be what kids should learn about British culture, the Idol series.  It would have been nice to offer some culture in this movie that kids can learn about British life, and not have kids believe technology or even robots are completely bad.

We love Postman Pat, so I turned on this movie last night. It is really scary. Not for preschoolers. It was even unnerving for me. Not only are there hoards of Patbots (robots that infiltrate and fool the whole town) and Jessbots, but they won't die! There is a touching moment where they defeat a few robots and Pat gives a speech about the importance of family and community. Then more Patbots flood the theater and a Jessbot appears to attack jess without any further, terminator style. That's when I turned out of. I'm my preschooler didn't have nightmares last night. This is not OK. At least give it a rating so we know it's not the same old lovable, mild, Postman Pat!

According to my 5 year old, this an awesome film. The movie is aimed at pre-schoolers. There is some humor that will go over their heads, while adults will find it quite laughable. Adults who have grown up with the Postman Pat series shows will not appreciate the films maker messing with their beloved Postman Pat character, but my pre-schooler loved this movie, and it was entertaining enough for me to watch it with him. If your pre-schooler loves animated robots and musical productions, he will love this movie.

I reluctantly watched this movie because my daughter wanted to see it, but I am glad I did.  The plot is interesting, and the message and warmth of the characters is charming from beginning to end.  One quickly forgives the relatively simple animation thanks to the story and the good music.  Definitely worth watching.
